伦敦高等法院周四裁定，受制裁的俄罗斯亿万富翁米哈伊尔·弗里德曼 (Mikhail Fridman) 每月不能花费数千英镑来维护他的伦敦豪宅，该豪宅内藏有价值 4400 万英镑（5320 万美元）的艺术品。

弗里德曼将英国制裁办公室 OFSI 告上法庭，因为该办公室拒绝让他每月花费 3 万英镑，以防止他以 6500 万英镑购买的阿斯隆别墅年久失修。

这位 59 岁的老人还希望每月在通信系统上花费 1,850 英镑，弗里德曼表示，这些系统负责管理 Athlone House 的电话、IT、照明、供暖和安全。

他的律师辩称，阿斯隆之家是“一个具有独特需求的独特财产……尤其是考虑到其艺术收藏”。

弗里德曼还希望被允许在非保安人员身上花钱，包括一名司机——他曾表示，他被拒绝了，理由是他可以乘坐公共交通工具。

然而，在上周听证会前不久，他离开英国前往以色列，然后前往俄罗斯，随后放弃了能够支付司机工资的说法。

金融制裁实施办公室 (OFSI) 表示，已授权弗里德曼偿还欠款并一次性支付总计约 140 万英镑的款项，加上未来每年支付的 76 万英镑。

在周四的书面裁决中，法官 Pushpinder Saini 驳回了弗里德曼针对 OFSI 的案件，称其决定是合法的。

弗里德曼的律师告诉塞尼，他希望能够返回英国，但塞尼在裁决中表示，弗里德曼的返回“不可能”，因为他实际上受到旅行禁令的约束。

弗里德曼驻伦敦的律师没有立即回应置评请求。

英国政府发言人对周四的判决表示欢迎，称该判决表明“我们的金融制裁许可制度有效”。

去年 12 月，英国国家犯罪局突袭了位于伦敦北部的阿斯隆大厦 (Athlone House)，弗里德曼对此提出了单独的法律挑战。

据《福布斯》杂志估计，这位俄罗斯亿万富翁的净资产为 128 亿美元，自 2022 年 3 月（俄罗斯入侵乌克兰一个月后）以来，他一直受到英国制裁。

9月，英国制裁制度对他的认定进行了更新，删除了对他“亲克里姆林宫寡头”的提及。

周四展开的一项调查，旨在确定约翰内斯堡一场导致 77 人死亡的火灾的责任，这让占领市中心废弃建筑并非法出租的团伙成为人们关注的焦点。

8 月 31 日，南非经济中心一栋破旧的建筑发生火灾，里面挤满了外国移民，这是人们记忆中最严重的灾难之一。许多受害者被烧得面目全非。

居民们表示，灾难发生时，该建筑已被犯罪集团接管，他们向居住者收取费用，剥削他们，但也为那些可能无家可归的人提供更经济适用的住房。

约翰内斯堡市应急管理服务代理处长拉普拉内·莫纳根 (Rapulane Monageng) 在调查中表示：“当一座建筑物被劫持时，它就成为一颗定时炸弹。”

数百名警察在缅因州各地展开追捕一名因刘易斯顿镇酒吧和保龄球馆发生大规模枪击事件而被通缉的男子，新闻媒体报道死亡人数从 16 人到 22 人不等，另有数十人受伤。

官员们表示，周三的枪击事件造成多人伤亡，但拒绝提供具体数字。

州和当地警方确认 40 岁的罗伯特·R·卡德 (Robert R. Card) 为本案的嫌疑人，据报道，他今年夏天被送进了一家精神卫生机构。早些时候，他们在脸书上发布了一张照片，照片中一名留着胡须的男子穿着棕色连帽衫和牛仔裤，在一个犯罪现场，手里拿着一把似乎是半自动步枪的东西，处于射击位置。

缅因州公共安全专员迈克·索舒克 (Mike Sauschuck) 在新闻发布会上表示：“我们在缅因州各地部署了数百名警察来调查此案，以找到嫌疑人卡德先生。”

警方发现了一辆白色SUV，他们认为卡德开往里斯本镇，位于东南方约7英里（11公里）处，索舒克表示，刘易斯顿和里斯本的人们被要求留在室内。

多家媒体报道称，缅因州执法公告称卡德是一名训练有素的枪械教官和美国陆军预备役成员，最近报告称他有心理健康问题，包括失听问题。报道还称，他威胁要炸毁国民警卫队基地。

缅因州信息与分析中心的通知称：“据报道，卡德于 2023 年夏季被送往精神卫生机构两周，随后被释放。”

路透社无法验证该公告的真实性。美联社报道称，该文件已分发给执法官员。

军队没有立即回应有关卡德信息的请求，包括他的服役记录的详细信息。

这场流血事件震惊了美国东北角与加拿大接壤的缅因州，该州主要是农村地区。

警方称，当地时间晚上 7 点前不久，枪声首次爆发。酒吧和保龄球馆相距约 6.5 公里（四英里）。

刘易斯顿是安德罗斯科金县的前纺织中心和拥有 38,000 人的小镇，位于缅因州最大城市波特兰以北约 56 公里（35 英里）处。

“一个娱乐中心。一个保龄球馆。一家社区酒吧。美国人经常光顾的地方，应该感到安全……这些都是今晚缅因州发生多起枪击事件的犯罪现场，”枪支安全倡导组织布雷迪主席克里斯·布朗说，在一份声明中。

布雷迪表示，缅因州缺乏几类主要的枪支安全法，包括攻击性武器监管、普遍背景调查和允许执法部门暂时解除合法危险人员武装的“红旗”法。

奥本市长杰森·莱维斯克告诉记者，在刘易斯顿的“姐妹城市”奥本的一个团聚中心，就在安德罗斯科金河对面，一些家庭发现曾在酒吧和保龄球馆的亲戚在枪击事件中丧生。

莱维斯克说，周三晚上，官员们正在一个秘密的安全地点采访“所有年龄段”的枪击事件目击者。

一位美国官员在华盛顿表示，总统乔·拜登已经听取了情况通报，并将继续收到最新消息。

白宫表示，总统单独与缅因州州长珍妮特·米尔斯、参议员安格斯·金和苏珊·柯林斯以及国会议员贾里德·戈尔登就刘易斯顿枪击事件进行了电话交谈，并在袭击发生后表示提供全面的联邦政府支持。

估计死亡人数的范围将与缅因州任何一年通常发生的凶杀案数量相当。据缅因州警方称，自 2012 年以来，该州每年的凶杀案数量在 16 起至 29 起之间波动。

根据截至 7 月的趋势，自 2020 年 COVID-19 大流行开始以来，美国四人或四人以上枪击事件激增，根据截至 7 月的趋势，2022 年发生 647 起，预计 2023 年将发生 679 起。枪支暴力档案。

美国有记录以来最致命的现代大规模枪击事件是 2017 年拉斯维加斯乡村音乐节上一名枪手从高层酒店高处开枪造成 58 人屠杀的事件。

土耳其卫生部长周四表示，他已敦促世界卫生组织（WHO）保证为遭受以色列-哈马斯战争打击的加沙人提供医疗服务，但迄今为止所做的努力还不够。

北约成员国土耳其迄今已向埃及派遣了九架援助货机前往加沙地带，并提出在埃及设立一家野战医院以帮助治疗伤员，并在必要时将一些伤员空运到土耳其。它谴责以色列对巴勒斯坦飞地的袭击，并呼吁立即停火，以允许更多人道主义援助进入。

土耳其卫生部长法赫雷丁·科卡表示，他已在周三发出的一封信中提醒世卫组织总干事谭德塞，世卫组织有专业责任帮助有需要的平民，并告诉他，世卫组织的努力应该“比你们迄今为止所做的要大得多” 。

科卡在信中写道：“世卫组织负有领导责任，并通过紧急采取必要举措，必须确保加沙医疗保健供应的安全。”他将这封信发布在X（前身为推特）上。

世界卫生组织没有立即回复置评请求。

随着加沙战事和人道主义危机加剧，土耳其加强了对以色列的批评。

许多北约盟国和欧盟认为管理加沙地带的哈马斯武装分子是恐怖组织。

但周三，土耳其总统塔伊普·埃尔多安表示，哈马斯是一个为保护巴勒斯坦土地和人民而战的解放组织，同时抨击西方国家对以色列的支持。

尼日利亚最高法院周四维持了总统博拉·蒂努布的选举胜利，结束了他的两个主要竞争对手提出的法律挑战，他们认为他的胜利因违规行为而受到损害。

这项裁决将赋予71岁的蒂努布管理这个非洲人口最多国家的明确授权，该国正在努力应对两位数的通货膨胀、外汇短缺、奈拉疲软、普遍的不安全局势和原油盗窃问题。

经过三十年几乎不间断的军事统治后，尼日利亚于 1999 年恢复民主，但选举周期之后却不断有人指控操纵选票和舞弊。

最高法院七名法官做出的最终判决遵循了以往总统选举中出现的模式，但这些模式在法庭上受到了质疑。通过法院推翻结果的尝试均未成功。

人民民主党的阿提库·阿布巴卡尔和工党的彼得·奥比在二月份的投票中分别获得第二名和第三名，但他拒绝接受结果，并呼吁取消蒂努布的胜利。

两位反对派领导人对 9 月 6 日法庭支持蒂努布获胜的判决提出上诉。

他们在上诉中辩称，选举委员会未能以电子方式将投票站的结果传输到在线门户网站，这损害了其真实性。

他们还表示，蒂努布在联邦首都阿布贾赢得的选票不到25%，因此他没有达到成为总统的法定门槛。

法官驳回了他们的所有论点。

最高法院法官约翰·奥科罗表示：“这一上诉没有任何依据，特此驳回。”

法院还驳回了阿提库提出的新证据，指控蒂努布向选举机构提交了伪造的大学证书。蒂努布否认了这一点。

巴勒斯坦外交部长马利基周四表示，以色列正在对加沙发动一场“报复战争”，旨在彻底摧毁该地区，以色列军队轰炸巴勒斯坦飞地，以回应哈马斯 10 月 7 日对以色列发动的毁灭性袭击。

以色列表示，其地面部队已连夜挺进加沙，攻击哈马斯目标，以色列总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡表示，以色列正在“准备地面入侵”，这可能是其中之一。

马利基在海牙对记者说：“（加沙）发生了如此多的战争，这次不同。这一次是一场复仇之战。”

“这场战争没有真正的目标，而不是彻底摧毁加沙每一个宜居的地方。这场战争不是由军事计划指挥的，没有受到尊重的规范。所有国际战争规则都被违反。”

加沙正遭受以色列近三周的轰炸，这是由伊朗支持的管理加沙的哈马斯武装分子在以色列南部发动大规模杀戮引发的。以色列称其有权自卫。

马利基敦促国际领导人敦促以色列全面停火，以确保急需的人道主义援助能够进入加沙。

朴英洙在韩国首都万圣节周末人群拥挤事件中失去了唯一的儿子，造成 159 人死亡，一年后，她仍然无法打开他房间的门。

她说，在看到政府承担某种责任之前，她可能无法继续自己的生活。

Park 是 100 多名家庭成员之一，他们表示当局没有采取任何措施追究责任人的责任。

与朴槿惠 29 岁的儿子李南勋 (Lee Nam-hoon) 一样，大多数受害者都是 10 月 29 日前往首尔梨泰院夜生活区参加著名的万圣节派对的年轻人。

晚上10点左右，汉密尔顿酒店周围的狭窄街道和小巷里，人潮拥挤得让人呼吸困难。

尽管在大约四个小时内至少接到了 11 个紧急电话警告局势恶化，但当局未能在人群涌入之前做出反应，导致数十名受害者被压倒或心脏骤停。

李在车祸中身亡。他的女朋友幸存下来。

本周，小巷附近的区域被指定为纪念遇难者的场所。灾难后形成的政治断层线仍然很明显。

总统尹锡烈本周末不会参加首尔市政府附近的追悼会，一位官员告诉韩联社，这“更多的是反对党举行的政治集会”。

今年万圣节期间，梨泰院并未禁止聚会，但在灾难发生一周年之前，当局和警方一直在进行人群控制演习，该演习由人工智能支持的网络组成，由近 1000 个闭路电视摄像机组成。

梨泰院的死亡事件震惊了这个仍因 2014 年世越号渡轮沉没而伤痕累累的国家，那次事故造成 304 人死亡，其中包括 250 名在一次学校旅行中的儿童。

万圣节灾难引发了一段全国哀悼期，警方也于今年结束了一项调查，最终承认当局的疏忽和应对不力，并将 23 名官员移交起诉。

但没有任何高级政府官员因这场灾难而辞职或被免职。

朴说：“政府机构和青瓦台极其不负责任且无所作为。”

“这伤了我的心”

尹总统办公室在一份声明中表示，总统曾多次表示他“作为总统感到心碎和深感抱歉”，这一点没有改变。

"Our top priority is people's lives and safety; the government will continue to assess the national safety system and make necessary improvements," the office said.

Interior Minister Lee Sang-min - who has fended off efforts to impeach him over the incident - issued an apology to victims on Wednesday and expressed "infinite responsibility" for failing to protect lives.

Relatives of the victims want a special law that would allow an independent and comprehensive investigation into the cause of the crush. A bill, backed by the opposition, has yet to be passed by the National Assembly without the support of the ruling People Power Party.

"I just don't want the government to obstruct our effort," Park said with tears in her eyes, referring to the bid for an independent investigation.

Some ruling party lawmakers and a municipal official have accused the families and other critics of trying to profit from the tragedy, or even of acting on behalf of old rival North Korea.

Kim Young-nam, a mother who lost her daughter in the crush, said she wanted to restore the honour of victims subjected to baseless accusations of drug taking, and what critics said amounted to victim blaming for going out to mark the foreign festival of Halloween.

"It hurts my heart. We need a thorough investigation and preventative measures so that young people are never sacrificed like this," Kim said at a memorial altar outside Seoul's city hall.

Twenty-six of the victims were foreigners, from 14 countries including the US, Japan and Iran. A relative of one of them told a press conference on Thursday that foreign families felt isolated with no support from the government.

"Nothing is reported to us nor communicated to us," said Nari Kim from Austria, who lost her younger brother in the crush.

Jong-Woo Paik, chairman of the Korean Society for Traumatic Stress Studies, said the government had to show that lessons had been learned to avoid an erosion of trust in society.

"South Korea is an advanced country and the government should create an atmosphere and opportunities as a nation to overcome social disasters together," he said.

"In this aspect, the Itaewon tragedy has been deeply regrettable."

Israel said its ground forces had pushed into Gaza overnight to attack Hamas targets as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said it was "preparing for a ground invasion" that could be one of several.

"I will not elaborate on when, how or how many," he said in a televised update to citizens on Wednesday evening.

The besieged Palestinian enclave is already reeling from almost three weeks of Israeli bombardment, which was triggered by a mass killing spree in southern Israel by the Iranian-backed Hamas militants who run Gaza.

Hamas has threatened to kill some of the more than 200 hostages it brought back to Gaza, of whom Israel says more than half hold foreign passports, from 25 countries .

Other Iranian-backed groups have since attempted attacks on Israel elsewhere in the region; Western leaders fear that a high death toll among Palestinian civilians, who have already been killed in large numbers by Israeli air strikes, could spark a wider war.

US President Joe Biden held a call with Netanyahu, discussing "ongoing efforts to locate and secure the release" of Americans believed held hostage in Gaza, the White House said overnight.

It said safe passage for foreigners wishing to leave Gaza, a continuous flow of aid into the narrow coastal strip, which is blockaded by Israel, and a pathway to permanent peace with the Palestinian people were also discussed.

"The President reiterated that Israel has every right and responsibility to defend its citizens from terrorism and to do so in a manner consistent with international humanitarian law," the White House said.

The comments reflect a balancing act over US support for Israel's actions after Biden was criticised for casting doubt on Palestinian casualty figures.

NETANYAHU SUGGESTS MORE THAN ONE GROUND INVASION PLANNED

Israeli army radio said the military had overnight staged its biggest incursion into northern Gaza in the current war against Hamas, which Israel has vowed to eliminate.

The military later released video on X showing armoured vehicles crossing the highly fortified barrier from Israel and blowing up buildings "in preparation for the next stages of combat".

"Tanks and infantry struck numerous terrorist cells, infrastructure and anti-tank missile launch posts," it said.

Palestinians in Gaza said Israeli air strikes had pounded the territory again overnight and people living in central Gaza, near the Bureij refugee camp and east of Qarara village, reported intensive tank shelling all night.

Hamas did not comment directly on the Israeli report but said its armed wing had struck an Israeli helicopter east of Bureij. The Israeli military said it was "not aware of this".

Israel has carried out weeks of intense bombardment of the densely populated Strip following the Oct. 7 Hamas attack on Israeli communities, which it says killed some 1,400 people.

Gaza's heath ministry said on Wednesday that more than 6,500 Palestinians had been killed in the air strikes.

In Jabalia refugee camp in northern Gaza, an Israeli air strike hit a house, killing a mother, her three daughters and a baby boy.

The father said his parents had been made homeless by Israelis in 1948 and that he would not leave, whatever happened. Holding the baby's body, with those of his family nearby, he said:

"He is only two months and a half old, what did he do? Did he kill? Did he wound someone? Did he capture someone? They were innocent children inside their house."

The director of the Nasser hospital in the southern city of Khan Younis, Nahed Abu Taaema, said the bodies of 77 people killed in air strikes had been brought in overnight, most of them women and children, Hamas's Al-Aqsa radio station reported.

Many Palestinians are sheltering in Khan Younis's hospitals, schools, homes and existing refugee camps and on the street after Israel warned them to leave their homes in the north.

Israel did not respond directly to the report but said its forces had struck a Hamas surface-to-air missile launch post in the Khan Younis area, which it said had been placed next to a mosque and kindergarten.

It was not clear if both sides were referring to the same incident.

Humanitarian supplies are critically low but world powers failed at the United Nations to agree on how to call for a lull to the fighting to deliver significant amounts of aid. Mass graves have begun to be used as the civilian toll has mounted.

The Palestinian Red Crescent said 12 trucks had crossed from Egypt carrying food, water and medical supplies on Thursday, making 74 trucks since Saturday, still only a small fraction of Gaza's peacetime needs. Israel has not allowed fuel in, saying Hamas would just add it to its stockpile.

A senior Ukrainian official said on Thursday the election of Mike Johnson, a US Republican who has been an opponent to Ukraine aid, as speaker of the House of Representatives would not affect Washington's vital assistance for Kyiv.

Johnson, who was named House speaker on Wednesday, told reporters he supported further aid to Ukraine " with conditions ", with accountability and clear objectives from the White House.

Oleksiy Danilov, secretary of Ukraine's National Security and Defence Council, said Johnson's election was good for Ukraine because it ended a three-week leadership vacuum in the House.

"I'm more than sure that cooperation will continue, assistance will continue," Danilov said in televised comments.

"The statement made by the speaker that they would like to check the assistance they provide – this is a completely natural thing. We're happy to provide all information about the aid, there are no secrets."

Ukraine relies heavily on support from its partners - both militarily and economically. Recent calls from within the United States to review or cut assistance to Kyiv have raised concerns about the future of the aid.

US President Joe Biden asked Congress last week to pass a $106 billion funding package which included billions of dollars in assistance for Ukraine.

Reporting by Yuliia Dysa; editing by Tom Balmforth and Deborah Kyvrikosaios ; Thu, 26 Oct 2023 10:12:07 GMT HIWDEV6LLJNZTMF7W4CSOCB54A https://www.reuters.com/world/ukraine-says-election-new-us-house-speaker-wont-affect-future-aid-2023-10-26/Reuters乌克兰CRISIS/US SPEAKER AID Armenia's PM Pashinyan says he hopes for Azerbaijan peace deal

Armenia hopes to conclude a peace agreement with Azerbaijan in the coming months and establish diplomatic relations with it, Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan said on Thursday.

After decades of enmity between Baku and Yerevan, Azerbaijan last month retook the contested region of Nagorno-Karabakh in a lightning offensive, prompting the mass exodus of most of its 120,000 ethnic Armenians to neighbouring Armenia.

Since then, the two South Caucasus countries have both declared a willingness to sign a peace deal, though progress has been fitful and regular border skirmishes have continued.

"In the coming months (we hope) we shall sign with Azerbaijan an agreement on peace and the establishment of diplomatic relations," Pashinyan said through an interpreter at a forum in Tbilisi also attended by the prime ministers of Azerbaijan and Georgia.

Azerbaijani Prime Minister Ali Asadov told the forum that Baku had been committed to peace and the restoration of transport links with Armenia since 2020, but that progress hinged on Yerevan's willingness to act.

Karabakh, regarded internationally as part of Azerbaijan, had been ruled by breakaway ethnic Armenians since the breakup of the Soviet Union in the 1990s until last month.

Pashinyan also said on Thursday that Armenia hopes to open its border with Turkey, a close ally of Azerbaijan, to citizens of third countries and holders of diplomatic passports.

That frontier has been closed since 1993, when Turkey cut off relations with Armenia as war raged between Yerevan and Baku over Nagorno-Karabakh. Turkey has declined to reopen the border without a peace settlement between Yerevan and Baku.

Separately, the Kremlin said on Thursday it hoped that Armenian authorities would clarify comments made by Pashinyan in an interview with the Wall Street Journal that he saw no advantage in retaining Russian military bases in Armenia.

According to a full transcript of the interview published by Armenian state news agency Armenpress on Thursday, Pashinyan also said that Yerevan was "not discussing" calling on Russia to remove its troops from Armenia.

Russia has several military facilities in Christian Armenia, which remains a treaty ally of Moscow. Relations have soured in recent months, with Armenia accusing Moscow of failing to support it against mainly Muslim Azerbaijan, with which Russia is also allied.

In its turn, Moscow has accused Pashinyan of neglecting Armenia's traditional close ties with Russia and pivoting increasingly towards the West.

Reporting by Felix Light Editing by Gareth Jones ; Thu, 26 Oct 2023 10:07:45 GMT NMN57P226NO45PM7MY5YDIUJNU https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/armenias-pm-pashinyan-we-hope-peace-with-azerbaijan-soon-2023-10-26/Felix Light亚美尼亚AZERBAIJAN/PEACE (UPDATE 2, TV, PIX) Kiribati atoll 2,000 km from Hawaii gets U.S. wharf as China eyes airport

A Pacific atoll 2,000 miles west of Hawaii appears set for a construction boom, with the United States and Australia on Thursday pledging a wharf for remote Kanton Island as China considers plans to revive a World War Two airfield.

Kiribati's population of 115,000 is scattered among 33 atolls over 3.5 million sq km (1.3 million sq miles) of ocean, and it has been a base for both US and Chinese space tracking stations at different times.

One atoll, in particular, has recently become a focus for Washington and Beijing, after China resumed diplomatic ties with Kiribati, pronounced "kiribass", in 2019.

Kanton Island is a strip of land just 50 metres wide in some places whose 43-km length encloses a parallelogram-shaped lagoon. During World War Two it was a US military base, with a wharf big enough for large ships, and a refuelling stop for flights between the United States and Australia.

Kiribati says it wants to build a hotel there to attract tourists.

In a joint statement on Thursday, US President Joe Biden and Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said they would co-finance maritime infrastructure in Kiribati, and rebuild Kanton Wharf.

The US had already committed $29m to help Kiribati youth employment at a White House summit for the Pacific Islands last month.

China for its part sent experts to the atoll in March to conduct a feasibility study to build a Kanton Island Airport, with Chinese visitors able to travel to Kiribati visa-free from this month.

A Chinese diplomat in Kiribati told Reuters in a statement on Thursday that the proposal was still being studied.

However, a China Daily editorial last month said the US had tried to block the Chinese plan.

The Chinese diplomat said Kiribati had pulled out of China's Belt and Road Forum in Beijing this month, citing its need to prepare to host a Pacific Islands fisheries meeting. Kiribati's government did not respond to a request for comment.

A Pacific expert at the Australian National University, Graeme Smith, said that amid strategic competition in the Pacific Islands, Kiribati was seen as a "country up for grabs - whether it sits in the China or US camp".

"It is western Pacific, which is really America's backyard. It is very close to Hawaii," he said.

Washington pledged billions in economic support to nearby Palau, Federated States of Micronesia and Marshall Islands, under Compacts of Free Association (COFA) struck in the 1980s that saw the US retain responsibility for their defense .

Kiribati, just as important geographically, got no such deal, Smith said.

中国外交部长王毅周四开始对华盛顿进行期待已久的访问，美国和中国寻求管理深刻的战略分歧，并为预期的乔·拜登总统和习近平总统之间的峰会铺平道路。

中东战争给超级大国之间紧张的关系增添了新的活力，华盛顿希望北京能够利用其对伊朗的影响力来帮助确保以色列与哈马斯的冲突不会蔓延到更广泛的地区。

然而，尽管北京和华盛顿都谈到寻找可以合作的领域，而且习近平周三表示中国愿意就全球挑战进行合作，但专家预计不会立即取得进展。

拜登政府与北京的首要任务是防止世界两大经济体之间的激烈竞争，以及防止在贸易、台湾和南海等一系列问题上的分歧演变成冲突。

美国国务卿安东尼·布林肯将于周四在国务院欢迎王毅，并于周二向联合国安理会表示，他将与王毅合作，防止中东冲突蔓延。

中国和美国的政策分析人士表示，避免更广泛的战争符合双方的共同利益，而且中国作为主要石油购买国，可以对伊朗施加相当大的影响。

但北京是否会使用它还有待观察，专家表示，中国可能会继续观望一段时间。

华盛顿战略与国际研究中心中东项目负责人乔恩·奥尔特曼表示：“中国当然有兴趣阻止美伊直接对抗，因为他们是主要石油消费国，这会导致油价上涨。”

“不过，中国人不太可能在这里做任何繁重的工作。我预计，当以色列和加沙的斗争得到解决时，他们会希望在谈判桌上占有一席之地，但他们觉得没有太大的必要或能力来加速解决。”

王拜登

中国人民大学国际关系教授时殷弘表示，北京对伊朗施加影响“几乎是美国对中国在中东局势上唯一严肃而实际的期望”。

但史补充道：“美国在伊朗问题上的立场远不能为中国所接受，反之亦然。在这个问题上的相互妥协可能太有限、太小，没有任何意义。”

华盛顿强调了中国影响伊朗的能力的重要性。布林肯上周在中东之行期间与王通电话，要求他利用北京的影响力确保冲突不会扩大。

中国呼吁各方保持克制并停火，以回应以色列对加沙的轰炸，以报复哈马斯 10 月 7 日发动的袭击，以色列称此次袭击造成 1,400 人死亡。哈马斯统治的加沙卫生部周三表示，以色列的报复性空袭已造成 6,500 多人死亡。路透社尚未能够独立核实双方的伤亡数字。

中国驻联合国大使张军周二表示：“中国一直在为推动停止敌对行动、恢复和平作出不懈努力。我们一直与有关各方保持着密切沟通。”

王毅此次访问华盛顿之前，包括布林肯在内的多位美国高级官员在过去几个月访问了北京。

这位资深的中国外交官预计将于周五会见拜登的国家安全顾问杰克·沙利文。两名美国官员表示，预计他还将在拜登访问白宫期间与他进行交谈，尽管目前尚不清楚他们的互动会有多大。

拜登与习主席的会面之路

分析人士预计，讨论的重点将是拜登和习近平将于 11 月 11 日至 17 日在旧金山举行的亚太经合组织 (APEC) 国家峰会期间举行的会晤的准备工作。这将是拜登和习近平的首次会面。自去年 11 月巴厘岛峰会以来，人们一直在聚会。

华盛顿史汀生中心中国项目主任孙云表示，“有一些实质性的事情需要解决和敲定。” “（王）来这里只是为了谈判——重要的成果将留待最高领导人宣布。”

周三，习近平表示，华盛顿和北京能否建立“正确”的相处方式并管理分歧，对世界至关重要。

双方从不同的经济角度讨论 APEC，经济政策分析师表示，在 COVID-19 大流行之后，美国在应对充满挑战的全球形势方面比中国要好一些。

美国和中国官员周一就宏观经济发展举行了一次虚拟会议，美国称会谈“富有成效和实质性”，中国称会谈“深入、坦诚和建设性”。

美国官员表示，台湾和南海和东海问题也将被列入议程，他们指责北京针对敌对领土主张者采取“破坏稳定和危险的行动”。

他们表示，与中国重建军事关系仍然是美国的首要任务，以避免意外冲突。

中国的《环球时报》小报强调了两国关系中的矛盾。

文章称，“虽然中美在不同领域的互动迅速恢复”，但美国试图“遏制”中国的政策没有改变，并指责华盛顿“频繁利用各种机会”，采取“双面策略”。抹黑中国、制造摩擦。”
